nodes.text: Sounds like you're in a good mood today.
Today I saw an angel with hair like freshly picked mulberries and lips like marinara sauce.
I'm writing a song about her...

"You ought to see Sophia, she is so sweet to me-ah!
I'd sit on her veranda,
If I could have Miranda,
Oh how happy I would be
If I could kiss Sophie."
Do you think she will like it?
Sophia will probably be very flattered that you wrote it for her.
Yes.
Why don't you sing it for her and find out?
No... not yet. I'm not sure it's good enough for her.
Maybe you should stick to playing your panpipes.
(sigh)
So who is this woman of your dreams?
Sophia Miranda is the school receptionist.
So you're in love with the school receptionist?
I was going outside to practice my bongos on the beach when I saw her sitting at her desk like Venus resting on her half-shell... except for the short hair and glasses part.
I stood in awe of her beauty and she spoke to me!
She said, "Are you going out, coming in, or just going to stand like a statue there for the whole day?"
She's clever as well as cute.

Shawn - you got to help me. Please, speak to Sophia and tell her that I'm a nice guy who is funny and witty and who would love to take her dancing sometime on a date. Will you please speak to her for me?
Sure, I'll tell Sophia what a funny guy you are.

nodes.name: Talking to Sophia
nodes.description: Somehow, I let myself get talked into talking to the school receptionist, Sophia, about Aeolus' crush on her. The things we do for friends! Who knows, maybe it will turn out well...

nodes.text: Tell her that her eyes are like amber pools of ale and that her hair looks like the sunset reflected in a glass filled with Dolcetto wine.
Check - I'll tell her you find her intoxicating.
Tell her that her voice is like the dulcet tones of a peacock serenading his mate.
Mating peacocks... right.
Let her know that I want to take her out to a reasonably priced restaurant and I'll pick up most of her tab for her.
Thanks, Shawn, you are a great pal to do this for me.
Why don't you speak to Sophia yourself? You're a clever guy.
I'm afraid that my tongue will be tied in a knot with my stomach and I'll come across like a dork.
So basically you're afraid that it will all be for knot?
Knot funny, Shawn. It may be noose to you, but I'm at the end of my rope here. Don't you get it?
Frayed knot.

options.text: Tell Aeolus to Talk to Sophia Himself

nodes.text: Look Aeolus, you need to speak to Sophia yourself.
I know I do... but I can't. One look at her and my brain turns into a jellyfish. I'll start jabbering away like a chimpanzee spouting nonsense before I know what I'm saying.
So you're afraid you are going to make a monkey of yourself...
She probably thinks I'm ape-alling.

options.text: Ask Aeolus to Clean Up the Room

nodes.text: I don't suppose that you would clean up this room so that I can at least get to look out the window?
I'll try to get to it this weekend.
If there was any more junk on the floor of this room, I'd open a secondhand store.
That's your purview on the ragtag blues or am I just second hand news? I'll get around to paying my dues, say, next Tuesday.
Sweet dreams, Aeolus.
I won't be able to sleep a wink tonight dreaming of Sophia.
Fine, as long as you dream quietly. I'm going to sleep.
